metadata.feature_description: Implements lazy loading, caching, and reactive UI updates for optimal performance.

steps.action: Navigate to DNN site and login as superuser
steps.expected: PersonaBar should load quickly without noticeable delay
steps.actual: PersonaBar loaded immediately after login. All menu items (Dashboard, Content, Manage, Page Analytics, Settings, Accounts, Edit) appeared without delay.

steps.expected: All PersonaBar elements should render properly
steps.actual: PersonaBar rendered correctly with all icons and menu structure intact. Initial load was fast and responsive.

steps.expected: Users list should load with pagination showing page 1
steps.actual: Users panel opened showing 'Showing 1-10 of 18 entries' with pagination controls and '10 users per page' dropdown.

steps.action: Click next page button to navigate to page 2
steps.expected: List should update reactively without full page reload
steps.actual: User list reactively updated to show 'Showing 11-18 of 18 entries' with different users (Test User4, Test User3, Test User2, etc.). No page reload occurred - Knockout.js observable arrays updated the DOM reactively.

steps.action: Type 'admin' in the search box and press Enter
steps.expected: User list should filter reactively to show only matching results
steps.actual: List reactively filtered to show only 'Test Admin' user. The filter was applied without page reload, demonstrating Knockout.js reactive binding working correctly.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test Lazy Loading of Task List

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar and look for Tasks panel
steps.expected: Tasks panel should be visible for testing lazy loading
steps.actual: Tasks panel is not visible in the PersonaBar UI. Code review of evoq.js (lines 100-102) shows '$tasks.hide(); return;' with comment 'hide task bar per CONTENT-8436'. The Tasks panel is intentionally hidden.

issues: Tasks panel is intentionally hidden in the UI (CONTENT-8436). Cannot test task-specific lazy loading via UI.

steps.action: Attempt to verify 30-second auto-refresh in Tasks panel
steps.expected: Tasks panel should auto-refresh every 30 seconds
steps.actual: Cannot test - Tasks panel is hidden in UI. Code review confirms setInterval(refreshTasks, 30 * 1000) exists in tasks.js line 366, but UI is inaccessible due to CONTENT-8436.

issues: Tasks panel is hidden (CONTENT-8436). Code shows 30-second interval is implemented but cannot be tested via UI.

observations: Code review confirms Tasks panel is intentionally hidden per CONTENT-8436 (evoq.js lines 100-102: '$tasks.hide(); return;'). This prevents UI testing of task-specific performance features.
The tasks.js file implements: lazy loading via loadMore() function, 30-second auto-refresh via setInterval(refreshTasks, 30 * 1000), and Knockout.js observables for reactive updates.
Knockout.js reactive updates ARE functional and can be verified through the Users panel (pagination and search filtering work reactively).

The following suggested test scenarios cannot be executed via UI due to hidden Tasks panel: lazy loading of task list, 30-second auto-refresh, testing with 1000+ tasks, memory usage verification, slow network testing, caching verification, concurrent user load.
PersonaBar load performance appears optimal - menu items render quickly without noticeable delay.
